faqs.question: Ile kosztuje ta nieruchomość?

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and EU citizens can purchase Spanish property without residency restrictions. The process involves obtaining a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), engaging a Spanish notary, and completing property transfer documentation. Most transactions close within 4-6 weeks.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Koszty nabycia nieruchomości wynoszą zazwyczaj 6-8% of purchase price, including: 3% property transfer tax (ITP), 1-2% legal/notary fees, and 1-2% administration costs. Separate mortgage arrangements (if applicable) add standard banking fees. Professional advisors manage documentation efficiently.

faqs.question: What rental income can this property generate?
faqs.answer: Comparable 3-bedroom apartments in Pilar de La Horadada achieve €800 weekly rates during peak season, generating approximately €41,600 annual income at 75% occupancy. Shoulder seasons command €500-600 weekly rates. Long-term rentals yield €1,200-1,400 monthly, providing portfolio diversification.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca to dobre miejsce na zakup nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca offers consistent 7-8% annual appreciation, established expat communities, year-round tourism, and affordable entry pricing compared to northern European markets. Pilar de La Horadada specifically provides below-average pricing with strong fundamental demand.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Pilar de La Horadada runs 35-45% below UK equivalents. Monthly expenses for a couple: €1,200-1,600 including rent, utilities, groceries, dining, and healthcare. Property owners benefit from low municipal taxes and affordable professional services.

faqs.question: Ile wynosi podatek od nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Roczne podatki od nieruchomości (IBI) in Pilar de La Horadada average €300-500 depending on property value and local rates. Capital gains tax (19%) applies when selling—though primary residences receive exemptions. Non-resident property owners pay annual wealth tax of 0.4-0.8%.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign investors routinely secure Spanish mortgages. Spanish banks offer 70-80% loan-to-value financing at competitive rates (currently 3.5-4.5%). EU citizens require standard documentation; non-EU buyers may need additional verification. Professional mortgage advisors streamline approval processes.
